review_title: Undercover nursing home in the care suites
job_title: Home Health Aide in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Some residents know we are understaffed and are happy we show up even if we are late. They understand the hard work we do and are shocked for the amount of rent they pay that aides are not happy for the low wages.
cons:
Over-worked, back breaking, and low pay. Some residents are skilled nursing in the care suites, but upper management would rather have rooms filled and break the aides backs then more residents to the appropriate location. This in turn makes residents demanding (knowing only 2 aides work floors) and in turn aides are fired making the floors understaffed and unsafe. 

Saying aides should seek further education is insulting. Many aides have families to support, so going to school full time and working isn't easy to do. 

Basically, as long as augustana looks good on camera everything is fine..

pros: great work environment, friendly coworkers.
cons: not the best benefits or overall employee appreciation.

job_title: Activities Director in Apple Valley, MN
pros: It is a friendly environment
cons: A bit far from where I live

pros: I have worked for this company for a short time. I have been totally embraced and welcomed by employees from all of the depts. As a Lead Receptionist, I can view from my location what goes on around me. I see the residents are treated with dignity and respect by all of the depts. It is a great environment to work in, as everyone is willing to help. Questions were answered in a timely manner. Throughout my day, residents will stop by the front desk. They will converse with me, as well as tell me about their day and the activities they are looking forward to. It is a very positive place to work, and the residents are happy. They have alot of options to pick from on a daily basis, including their meals. Great food. I have eaten lunch almost everyday.
cons: Cannot think of any cons. I have been very happy with the workplace environment. It is very positive and alot of the employees have been there for along time.

review_title: awful treatment to the people who do all the hard work
pros: a few elderly clients who are sweet
cons: at the moose lake facility, if you are a nurse or cna who is sick or needs a day off they will not find anyone to work for you because it is not in their "contract" to have an agency come in to relieve you. they depend on a pool of "on call" people who never answer their phone to come in because pay is only 11.33-12.89-TOPS! awful pay for the level of workhorse they need for heavy,  hard to please, picky, rude and very needy residents. I would never recommend this place to my worst enemy..

pros:
The residents (developing relationships)
Some staff
cons:
Management doesn't care about the safety of staff and sometimes the residents. I've received so many complaints from family members about lack of care. They just hire anyone from off of the street whether they have experience or not. Theft is a number one issue and the problem is never resolved. 

Racism - especially at the front office is so alive and not acknowledged, there is no employee camaraderie, respect and defiantly no trust, everything is always swept under the rug and never addressed. This establishment is filled with nothing but DRAMA and UNPROFESSIONALISM. 

Low pay - everyone
High turnover
Security is a joke (not reliable)

job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Burnsville, MN
pros:
Their mission is definitely oriented towards a Christian care of the elderly and they encourage and train you to serve the residents. 
My experience of the mentors is that they really want you to love what you are doing and do it well.
Good for a short time but would cause you to burn out.
cons:
poor pay
short staffed
poor communication systems for finding subs for shifts
often necessary to miss breaks 
lots of turnover

pros: I feel valued and appreciated by our residents and the management when I am at work.  I have worked at a few Augustana sites but Minneapolis is my favorite because of variety of people I care for and work with.  Also this is the first time where I have worked at a place that the CEO or other top level executives to greet you by name in the hallway.
cons: It would be nice if they had more employee team building activities, I think those are helpful.

pros: People who do an excellent job taking care of our elderly population.  Lot's of dedicated, loving staff.  Mission driven organization.
cons: Turnover.  Low wages (when CEO and CFO make way too much!)  An executive team that doesn't get what it's like working in the trenches.  Not sure if they remember what their mission statement really is.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Apple Valley, MN
pros: Offers full time. Great place for New Graduates to learn.
cons: Management TCU floor same as LTC, cases usually are sub acute but still nurses are under staff.

pros: Many good and caring colleagues. Professional attitude. Generally good clinical leadership. Stability of staff because of clinical management.
cons: Generally poor connection between margin-and growth driven operational and strategic leadership and professed values of organization.

pros: Augustana is a great caring company to work for and great team to be on.
cons: Augustana may not be competitive with wages in your area look into it.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Moose Lake, MN
pros: You get to be nice to people.  You get training and benifits if you want them.
cons: Alot of responsibility for each person in a very important job.  Many illnesses that could be spread from person to person.

pros: Lovely seniors to befriend, great staff. I worked in the apartments and the leadership was really really wonderful!
cons: Lack of innovation and technology for employees. The IT department is really behind the times.

pros:
Integrity of senior management.
Solid strategic direction.
Healthy company culture.
cons:
No room for growth unless you're a licensed healthcare professional.
Very conservative environment.

review_title: Augustana Care treats their employees like they are family
pros: Great benefits, competitive pay, easily promoted
cons: Behind in technological advances but slowly making progress

pros: Residents are great and make the job worth it
cons: Not enough workers and some workers don’t follow set schedules

review_title: Great place to train for CNA
pros: Good place to train for CNA
cons: Hard to care for so many people who needed feeding and lifts.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Minneapolis, MN
pros: good company friendly management
cons: Too much downtime no advancement

pros: Augustana has some of most talented employees and a very supportive Management team.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: not a good company to work for
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Apple Valley, MN
pros: I love a lot of my patients enjoy working with the elderly
cons: They feel that all employees are replaceable

review_title: Good at first. Then Augustana took over management and things got bad. Nothing but lies. Faith-based I think not!
pros: Working with Residents and helping them.
cons: Nothing but lies and deceit.b
